Similarly, for Wolverhampton Wanderers (1972-73): They beat Arsenal 3 - 1, so again a two-goal margin, which would be a difference of two points if each goal is worth a point. Wolverhampton Wanderers' match was 3-1 against Arsenal. So again, that would be a two-point margin in terms of total goals, but perhaps the claim is using "point" differently. Alternatively, maybe it's referring to the aggregate goals as the points difference.

But 3-1 would be a two-point lead. So perhaps the claim's wording is inaccurate because only Stoke City beat their opponent by 1 point, but Wolves did so by 2 points.
